title: I really, really hate taxes
body: I've said it once, and I'll say it again: I hate taxes. My total income for this year was well below poverty level, but I don't think that matters... for whatever reason. I know little to nothing about taxes, but my sister does (she's a CPA). So another year, another HUGE tax payment. With the money we spent on taxes this year, I could've... bought... something... pretty big. AND to make my day even worse, I just received this e-mail from the good people at ConAgra: Dear Mr. Chilton, Thank you for contacting us. We are always pleased to hear from our consumers but are sorry to inform you that we no longer produce Rosarita Enchilada Meals. As consumers' preferences for products change, so do the varieties of our products. Only the products with the greatest consumer appeal remain on the store shelves over time. Unfortunately, the product you inquired about did not have enough consumer interest for us to continue manufacturing it. The products we currently offer are those that have the greatest consumer demand. We appreciate the time you have taken to contact us and your interest in our products. Sincerely, ConAgra Foods Consumer Affairs I can't put into words how good Rosarita's enchiladas were. I'm tearing up just thinking about it. Nicole makes a pretty good version of the Rosarita-brand enchiladas, but it's just not the same. Why is the world against me? MoxieTV episode four just finished filming, so it should be ready in the very near future (i.e. later tonight). Now, I'm off to eat at Chic-fil-a!!!!
author: Dan

comments.author: Luke
comments.body:
Ugh.  Tell me about it.

Not only do I hate taxes for the same reasons you do (i.e. paying them), I hate them for the same reason your sister probably does...I'm a CPA.  This time of year sucks.

I always make time for new Moxie posts, and Moxie TV episodes.  Go Moxie!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Thanks for pointing that out Brian. My blog gets hit by an unusually high amount of comment spam, so I have to keep updating my spam-blocking functions. If you leave a comment and find that it doesn't show up, just try writing again... without the word Vi@gr@.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: If you all haven't tried the Rosarita enchilada kit, you missed something great. I am getting pretty sick of my favorite items being discontinued.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Dan just made fun of me for saying "you all."

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body:
Y'all should've become career students. No taxes for me! That said, I'm gonna be in the real world from July (for one year at least) so taxes both council and income await...

Dan, I presume you've considered adding one of the swirly letters things, and decided against it? I for one don't mind the additional hassle, since it's a pretty full proof system. Would take the pressure off you constantly changing filter settings, after all.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Indeed Fyse, I have considered the random image thing... but some of the spam is done by hand... by a person... or a half-robot / half-person. I hate comment spammers. Maybe I'll use this: KittenAuth

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body:
Some comment spam is done by hand? Good grief, I had no idea. What a depraved and soul destroying job...

The kitten thing is genius. Go with it. Or even better, use some of your copious free time to build your own moxie-fied version! Shouldn't be too tricky, and having a unique anti-spam system can only be a good thing.

comments.author: Amy
comments.body:
Yes, taxes suck.  I wouldn't mind paying mine and my husbands so much, except my accountant is always saying, "just get me that dependent's social security  number and it'll be okay," and then laughs at me when I suggest that the beagle and the corgi and the two cats, are ipso facto, dependents.

Why did Bush need a raise again?
